intro: Fremya, commonly known as the candle bush, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Rutaceae. It is native to Australia and consists of several species, most of which are shrubs or small trees. The plants are characterized by their pinnate leaves and showy, yellow or orange flowers that bloom in spring. Fremya species are often found in dry, sandy soils and are adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. They are also valued for their ornamental appeal and are sometimes used in horticulture.
